section.title: Present Simple and Present Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Simple to talk about routines and facts. Use the Present Continuous to talk about actions happening now, at the time of speaking.
section.text1: We have a pizza every Friday evening.
section.text1a: We're having our pizza now.
section.text2a: Susan is speaking French - her friend from Paris is on the phone.
section.sectiontitle2: We often use adverbs of frequency with the Present Simple. We often use phrases like at the moment, today and (right) now with the Present Continuous.
section.text3a: I'm taking the car today because it's raining.
section.text4: We hardly ever drink expensive wine.
section.text4a: We're drinking a very expensive wine at the moment because it's my birthday.
